Event.name: Finish_game
Event.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>Player</fen> finishes a <fen>Game</fen>, possibly with an outcome of winning or losing. A <fen>Game</fen> is an activity that is considered recreational, and is valued for associated pleasure, as well as social interaction, material reward, or status. Not all games can be won or lost. Those that are specifically competitions are defined in the inheriting frame Finish_competition. In some LUs, the <fen>Game</fen> is DNI.
<ex> <fex name="Player">John</fex> <t>won</t> <fex name="Game">the lottery</fex>! </ex> <ex> <fex name="Player">John</fex> <t>lost</t>. </ex> </def-root>

Arg.name: Manner
Arg.definition: <def-root>Any description of the <fen>Game</fen> which is not covered by more specific FEs, including epistemic modification (probably, presumably, mysteriously), secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). It may also indicate salient characteristics of a <fen>Player</fen> that also affect their action (presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully). </def-root>

Arg.name: Means
Arg.definition: <def-root>An action of the <fen>Player</fen> that results in the outcome of the <fen>Game</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Time
Arg.definition: <def-root>The time at which the <fen>Game</fen> takes place.</def-root>

Arg.name: Place
Arg.definition: <def-root>The location in which the <fen>Player</fen> finishes the <fen>Game</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Purpose
Arg.definition: <def-root>The purpose for which the <fen>Player</fen> wins or loses the <fen>Game</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Degree
Arg.definition: <def-root>The degree to which the <fen>Player</fen> wins or loses the <fen>Game</fen>.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: win.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: complete a game with a favorable outcome

lexUnit.name: lose.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: complete a game with an unfavorable outcome
